Final recipe cards

1) Bruschetta (serves 6)
Ingredients
- 12 San Marzano tomatoes, diced
- 6 garlic cloves, minced
- Fresh basil, about 3/4 cup chopped (or ~12 leaves)
- Baguette, 1 1/2 loaves (roughly 2 baguettes), sliced 1/2 inch thick
- Extra-virgin olive oil, 4 1/2 tablespoons (plus extra for brushing)
- Balsamic vinegar, 1 1/2 teaspoons (optional: up to 3)
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions
1) In a bowl, combine tomatoes, garlic, and basil. Drizzle with 3 tablespoons olive oil and balsamic (if using); season with salt and pepper. Toss and marinate 10–15 minutes.
2) Preheat oven to 375–400°F. Slice baguette and brush slices with about 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil. Toast on a sheet pan until golden, about 5–7 minutes.
3) Top each toasted baguette with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.

2) Pan-Seared Salmon with Lemon-Caper Dill Sauce (serves 4)
Ingredients
- 4 salmon fillets (8 oz each)
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
- Lemon juice, 2 tablespoons
- Capers, 2 tablespoons, drained
- Fresh dill, 2 tablespoons, chopped
- Salt and black pepper
- 1 teaspoon olive oil (optional, for searing)

Instructions
1) Preheat oven to 400°F.
2) Pat fillets dry; season with salt and pepper.
3) In a heavy ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil (if using) over medium-high. Add 2 tablespoons butter; swirl to coat. Sear salmon, skin-side down if present, 2–3 minutes until golden. Turn and sear 1–2 minutes.
4) Transfer skillet to oven and bake at 400°F for 14 minutes, or until just cooked through.
5) While salmon cooks, melt remaining butter; add lemon juice and capers; simmer 1–2 minutes. Stir in dill and season with salt.
6) Remove salmon, spoon sauce over, and serve.

Note: Salmon cooked in the oven for 14 minutes.

3) Roasted Asparagus (serves 4)
Ingredients
- 1 bunch asparagus
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions
1) Preheat oven to 400°F.
2) Trim ends; toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3) Roast on a sheet pan for 15 minutes, until tender-crisp.
Note: Roast alongside the salmon to finish together.

4) Tiramisu (serves 4)
Ingredients
- 5 egg yolks
- 3/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 1/3 cups mascarpone
- 2.5 cups heavy cream
- 2 cups espresso, cooled
- 3 tablespoons coffee liqueur
- 30 ladyfingers
- Cocoa powder, for dusting
- Optional: pinch of salt

Instructions
1) Brew espresso and cool; mix in coffee liqueur. Set aside.
2) In a heatproof bowl over simmering water, whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale (about 5–8 minutes). Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
3) Beat mascarpone until smooth; fold into the yolk mixture until well combined.
4) In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to soft peaks; fold into the mascarpone mixture until smooth.
5) Quickly dip each ladyfinger into the coffee mixture and layer in a 9x13-inch dish. Spread half the mascarpone filling over.
6) Dip and layer remaining ladyfingers, then top with the remaining mascarpone cream. Smooth top.
7) Dust with cocoa powder and refrigerate at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.

Bruschetta (serves 6)
- Ingredients
  - San Marzano tomatoes: 12
  - Garlic: 6 cloves
  - Fresh basil: 3/8 cup
  - Baguette: 1 1/2
  - Olive oil: 4 1/2 tablespoons
  - Balsamic vinegar: 1 1/2 to 3 teaspoons
  - Salt: to taste
  - Pepper: to taste
  - Bread slices (for serving): 1/2-inch thick
- Method
  - In a bowl, combine tomatoes, minced garlic, basil, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. Mix gently and let marinate 15–20 minutes.
  - While marinating, preheat oven to toast the bread. Lightly toast bread slices until golden.
  - Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted slices and serve.

Salmon (serves 4)
- Ingredients
  - Salmon fillets: 4 x 8 oz each
  - Butter: 3 tablespoons
  - Lemon juice: 1 tablespoon
  - Capers: 2 tablespoons
  - Dill: 2 tablespoons
- Oven temp: 400°F
- Bake time: 14 minutes
- Method
  - Preheat oven to 400°F. Place fillets on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
  - Top each fillet with butter, a little lemon juice, capers, and dill.
  - Bake 14 minutes, until cooked through.

Roasted asparagus (side)
- Ingredients
  - Asparagus: 1 bunch
  - Olive oil: to lightly coat
  - Salt: to taste
  - Pepper: to taste
- Oven temp: 400°F
- Roast time: 15 minutes
- Method
  - Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss asparagus with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  - Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast 15 minutes until tender-crisp.

Tiramisù (serves 8)
- Key quantities you asked for
  - Egg yolks: 5
  - Heavy cream: 2.5 cups
  - Ladyfingers: 30
- Additional ingredients (from current recipe)
  - Sugar: 3/4 cup
  - Mascarpone: 1 1/3 cups
  - Espresso: 2 cups
  - Coffee liqueur: 3 tablespoons
  - Cocoa powder: for dusting
  - Salt: pinch (optional)
- Method
  - Whisk yolks with sugar over a warm bath to create sabayon; cool slightly.
  - Fold in mascarpone until smooth.
  - Beat heavy cream to soft peaks, fold into mascarpone mixture.
  - Dip ladyfingers briefly in espresso mixed with liqueur; layer half in a dish.
  - Spread half the mascarpone mixture, layer remaining dipped ladyfingers, top with remaining mascarpone.
  - Dust with cocoa powder. Chill at least 4 hours (overnight preferred).

Here are the final recipe cards for each course.

1) Bruschetta (Appetizer)
- Serves: 6
- Ingredients
  - Baguette: 1 1/2
  - Diagonally cut bread slices: about 24
  - San Marzano tomatoes: 12
  - Garlic: 6 cloves
  - Fresh basil, chopped: 12–15 leaves
  - Extra-virgin olive oil: 4 1/2–6 tablespoons
  - Salt and black pepper: to taste
  - Optional: balsamic vinegar: 1 1/2–3 teaspoons
- Instructions
  - Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
  - Toast baguette slices 5–7 minutes until golden.
  - In a bowl, mix chopped tomatoes, minced garlic, basil, olive oil, salt, pepper.
  - Drizzle with balsamic vinegar if using.
  - Spoon mixture onto warm bread and serve.

2) Salmon (Main)
- Serves: 4
- Fillets: 4 fillets, 8 oz each
- Butter: 3 tablespoons
- Lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
- Capers: 1 tablespoon, drained
- Dill: 1 tablespoon, chopped
- Salt and pepper: optional
- Temperature: 400°F (200°C)
- Time: 14 minutes
- Instructions
  - Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
  - Place fillets on a sheet pan; dot with butter; drizzle lemon juice.
  - Top with capers and dill.
  - Bake for 14 minutes, until just opaque and flaky.

3) Roasted Asparagus (Side)
- Serves: 4
- Ingredients: 1 bunch asparagus; olive oil; salt; black pepper
- Temperature: 400°F (200°C)
- Time: 15 minutes
- Instructions
  - Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
  - Trim ends; toss with olive oil, salt, pepper.
  - Roast 15 minutes on a sheet pan (space permitting, front-load with salmon if desired).

4) Tiramisu (Dessert)
- Serves: 4
- Egg yolks: 5
- Heavy cream: 2 1/2 cups
- Ladyfingers: 30
- (Additional updated ingredients for a complete tiramisu)
  - Sugar: 3/4 cup
  - Mascarpone: 1 1/3 cups
  - Espresso: 2 cups
  - Coffee liqueur: 3 tablespoons
- Instructions
  - In a heatproof bowl over simmering water, whisk yolks with sugar until thick and pale; cool.
  - Fold in mascarpone until smooth.
  - Whip heavy cream to soft peaks; fold into mascarpone mixture.
  - Combine espresso and coffee liqueur.
  - Briefly dip each ladyfinger into the espresso mixture; lay a layer in a dish.
  - Spread half the mascarpone mixture; repeat with remaining ladyfingers and mascarpone.
  - Refrigerate at least 4 hours, ideally overnight.
  - Optional: dust with cocoa powder before serving.

Notes
- The latest updates used: Salmon bake time 14 minutes at 400°F; Asparagus 15 minutes at 400°F; Tiramisu with 5 yolks, 2 1/2 cups heavy cream, and 30 ladyfingers. If you’d like, I can format these into a printable card or adjust measurements for a different serving size.
